root.title: Yerbek I (e-147)
root.place: Found in place named Ongar-Hovu in 19 km from district Yerbek on right coast of the river Ulug-Kem.
root.description: The stele made from lilac sandstone. There are 5 lines of text.
root.size: Height - 270 см, length - 36 см, width - 28 см
root.investigation: Text is investigated by I.Kormushin 592.

refs.ref: Bazin L., Hamilton J.: Un manuscrit chinois et turc runiforme de Touen-Houang. British Museum Or. 8212 (78) et (79). In: Turcica 4, 25-42. [Neudruck in: TurcsMotsHommes, 37-50]
